intro: Impatiens ecornuta, commonly known as the hornless impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink, white, and red. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, shady environments. Impatiens ecornuta is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms. It is also valued in horticulture for its ability to thrive in partial shade and its relatively low maintenance requirements.
